About Me

Hi I am Rohit Konda ,

I am a current fifth year PhD student in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the UC Santa Barbara working under Dr. Jason R. Marden. Previously, I received a Masters degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering at the Georgia Institute of Technology in 2019 while working with Dr. Samuel Coogan and Dr. Magnus Egerstedt. Before that, I received a Bachelor’s degree in Biomedical Engineering at the Georgia Institute of Technology in 2018.

My current research focus is on algorithm design for complex systems that have provable guarantees on system behavior. Respectively, my work uses tools from control theory, optimization, and game theory and has deep implications in robotics, automation, and heavy industry, as well socio-technical systems.

Ph. D at UC Santa Barbara

2019 — present

Under the advisement of Jason Marden, my research focus has been on game theory and optimization. In my PhD, I have worked on two main projects. One project is analysis of best response behavior in multi-agent systems in different settings. The other project deals with optimizing the scheduling algorithms for heavy industrial refrigeration in cooperation with CrossnoKaye.

Masters of Science at Georgia Institute of Techonology

2018 — 2019

I received a M.S in Electrical and Computer Engineering, where my focus was on control systems and signal processing under the advisement of Dr. Sam Coogan and Dr. Magnus Egerstedt. My work focused on correct-by-construction methods in nonlinear control using control barrier functions with applications in autonomous driving.

Bachelor of Science at Georgia Institute of Techonology

2015 — 2018

I received a B.S in Biomedical Engineering, where my focus was on dynamical methods for the use of neuroscience. I engaged in experimental research on electrical stimulation of vagus nerves in mice, as well explored the use of Kuramoto models in decribing global behavior in neurons.
